body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper editor. Kentucky native. Married Martha Rankin Wallace Harney. Father of Benjamin Mills Harney, William Wallace Harney, Selby T. Harney, Ellen Martha Harney Lawson, and John Hopkins Harney, Jr. Graduated from Miami University in Oxford, Ohio, in 1827. Mathematics professor at Indiana University in Bloomington, Indiana from 1827 to 1833. Mathematics professor at Hanover College in Hanover, Indiana from 1833 to 1838. President of the Louisville Collegiate Institute in Louisville from 1838 to 1840. Author of An Algebra Upon the Inductive Method of Instruction in 1840. President of Louisville College in Louisville from 1840 to 1844. Publisher of the Louisville Democrat in Louisville from 1844 to 1868. Partner in publishing firm of Harney, Hughes, & Co. with William E. Hughes and John H. Bowman in Louisville in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Louisville from 1861 to 1863.
